Bithumb Airdrop Bitcoin มูลค่า 30 พันล้านดอลลาร์โดยความผิดพลาด

Bithumb Mistakenly Airdrops $30 Billion of Bitcoin

3h ago//Squiffs
bitcoin
AI

Summary

TH

Bithumb ตลาดซื้อขาย crypto รายใหญ่ของเกาหลี เผชิญกับความผิดพลาดร้ายแรงเมื่อส่ง 2,000 BTC ให้ผู้ใช้งานกว่า 200 ราย แทนที่จะส่งเงิน 2,000 WON ตามที่ตั้งใจไว้ เหตุการณ์นี้ทำให้ผู้รับพยายามขาย Bitcoin ทันที ส่งผลให้ราคาบนแพลตฟอร์มดิ่งลง 18% ชั่วคราวก่อนที่ทางเว็บจะระงับการทำธุรกรรมของบัญชีที่เกี่ยวข้อง ขณะนี้หน่วยงานกำกับดูแลการเงินของเกาหลีกำลังตรวจสอบเหตุการณ์นี้ ซึ่งค่าประเมินของการ airdrop ผิดพลาดอาจมีมูลค่าสูงถึง 30 พันล้านดอลลาร์

EN

Bithumb, a leading Korean crypto exchange, mistakenly airdropped 2,000 BTC to over 200 users instead of 2,000 KRW during a promotional event. The error caused recipients to immediately sell the assets, driving the platform's BTC price down by 18% before the exchange froze related accounts. Authorities are now investigating the incident, which potentially resulted in a total distribution value of up to $30 billion.

Key Points

  • Bithumb accidentally sent 2,000 BTC to users instead of 2,000 KRW
  • Recipients sold the Bitcoin immediately, causing an 18% price drop on the exchange
  • Korean financial regulators are investigating the potential $30 billion incident

Article

The Korean crypto exchange intended to send 2,000 WON to some users but accidentally sent 2,000 BTC instead. Bithumb, one of Korea’s leading centralized exchanges (CEX), made a multi-billion dollar mistake overnight when management accidentally sent 2,000 BTC, worth almost $140 million, to more than 200 users instead of 2,000 WON, which is worth less than $1.5. As users received the BTC, they immediately attempted to sell and offramp funds, briefly sending BTC on Bithumb almost 18% below the market price according to LookOnchain. BTC/KRW on Bithumb - LookOnchain The exchange addressed the situation in a notice that read, “During today's event payment process, an abnormal amount of Bitcoin was paid to some customers. As sales were made on some accounts that received the Bitcoin, the Bitcoin price temporarily fluctuated rapidly. Bithumb immediately recognized abnormal transactions through its internal control system and quickly restricted transactions to related accounts.” Korean outlet The Chosun Daily broke the news and said that “most” of the 240 users who partook in Bithumb’s Random Box promo event received 2,000 BTC in each of their wallets, and roughly $3 billion was withdrawn from the exchange. According to the local news outlet, the Financial Services Commission (FSC) and Financial Supervisory Service (FSS) in Korea are actively investigating the incident due to its magnitude. The exact number of BTC distributed has not been disclosed, but based on information provided by Chosun, the airdrop could have been worth up to $30 billion.
